A bus travels back and forth along a straight line from point 0 to point $a$.  The bus starts at point 0 and travels to point $a$, then immediately returns to point 0, and repeats this process.  

The bus has a fuel tank that can hold $b$ liters of fuel.  It consumes 1 liter of fuel to travel 1 unit of distance. There is a gas station at point $f$ between points 0 and $a$. The bus can refuel its tank completely at the gas station.

The bus needs to make $k$ trips. What is the minimum number of times the bus needs to refuel at the gas station to complete all $k$ trips? If it's impossible for the bus to complete $k$ trips, output -1.

A bus travels back and forth between two points. It needs fuel to travel, and there's a gas station at a specific point along the route.  Find the minimum number of times the bus needs to refuel to complete a given number of trips.
